org.apache.spark.util

Class FileLogger

  • Object
    • org.apache.spark.util.FileLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logging

    public class FileLogger
extends Object
implements Logging
    A generic class for logging information to file.

    • Method Detail

      • fileIndex

        public int fileIndex()

      • start

        public void start()
        Start this logger by creating the logging directory.

      • log

        public void log(String msg,
       boolean withTime)
        Log the message to the given writer.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be logged
        withTime - Whether to prepend message with a timestamp

      • logLine

        public void logLine(String msg,
           boolean withTime)
        Log the message to the given writer as a new line.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be logged
        withTime - Whether to prepend message with a timestamp

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flush the writer to disk manually.

        When using a Hadoop filesystem, we need to invoke the hflush or sync method. In HDFS, hflush guarantees that the data gets to all the DataNodes.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the writer. Any subsequent calls to log or flush will have no effect.

      • newFile

        public void newFile(String fileName,
           scala.Option<org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission> perms)
        Start a writer for a new file, closing the existing one if it exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the new file, defaulting to the file index if not provided.
        perms - Permissions to put on the new file.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Close all open writers, streams, and file systems. Any subsequent uses of this FileLogger instance will throw exceptions.
